Comment: It was originally closed down because it was really expensive to operate, and millions of dollars of repairs and maintenance were required.  I know it's been successful as a museum, but the museum doesn't allow visitors into all areas, and you *know* the museum have prioritized the maintenance money on the areas that are accessible to visitors.  Also, maintainance required to make it safe for the public to visit *is not the same* as maintenance required to make it suitable and secure habitation in which inmates can be safely incarcerated.  So yeah, makes good financial sense to run basic maintenance only for 62 years, *then* spend shit-tons of public money to open it again.  When will this sad old fuck finally disappear?

Comment: That's just splitting hairs. When we say that America elected Donald Trump or the UK voted for Brexit obviously we don't mean every last individual voted that way. But when a country makes a decision it affects the entire country.    And therefore _the country_ deserves whatever the consequences are.        I came of age politically during the Vietnam war. America started a big war in Vietnam and 58,000 Americans were killed.    Did each one of those individuals soldiers deserve to die? In a democratic system of government the question is irrelevant. It is certainly the case that America _as a country_ deserved to suffer for its stupid decision, and the same is true here.
